result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon M. Andersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,849.45 and restitution surcharge.
---------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------

No contact with Ace Hardware, Delavan, Wisconsin.
---------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the Agent. 
---------------------------

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs including mandatory DNA surcharge pursuant to Sec.973.046(1r), Wis. Stats.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

Defendant is committed for nine (9) months to the Walworth County Jail, concurrent with prison sentence on Count #1, Case 2014CF000056..
---------------------------
Concurrent with: Prison sentence on Count #1

Defendant Jon M. Andersen in court with attorney Larry D Steen.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:04 p.m. State calls Detective David Smith who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam by ADA Rea. 3:10 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Steen
3:12 p.m. Witness excused. State has no further evidence or witnesses. Defense has no witnesses/argumnet. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over.  Arraignment scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ACE HARDWARE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
